visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a chart with the following specifications: Chart type: column and line with a pie overlay. Chart title: 'Sales of petroleum products March, Norway'. Axes and labels styling: X-axis labels should be 'Jet fuel', 'Duty-free diesel', 'Petrol', 'Diesel', 'Gas oil'. Y-axis title should be 'Million liters'. Tooltip should display 'million liters' as the suffix. Data series: Three column series for years 2020, 2021, and 2022, a line series for the average, and a pie series for the total. Custom colors: Use Highcharts default colors. Additional configurations: Set border radius for columns, center the pie chart, and disable data labels for the pie series.

title.text: Sales of petroleum products March, Norway

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a multi-series chart that combines column, line, and pie series. The chart title is set to 'Sales of petroleum products March, Norway', and the X-axis is labeled with categories representing different petroleum products. The Y-axis is titled 'Million liters', and the tooltip displays the suffix 'million liters'. The chart includes three column series for the years 2020, 2021, and 2022, each with corresponding data. Additionally, a line series represents the average values, and a pie series shows the total values for each year. The pie series is centered and styled with inner size and custom colors. The column series have a border radius applied for a rounded appearance, and the pie series data labels are disabled for a cleaner look.
